meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an intellectual.
meanings.sent1: Her intellectualistic approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The professor's intellectualistic lectures were always thought-provoking.
meanings.sent3: He took an intellectualistic stance on choosing the best book for the book club.
meanings.sent4: The intellectualistic atmosphere in the library made her feel right at home.
meanings.sent5: The intellectualistic discussions at the conference left a lasting impression on the attendees.

meanings.definition: Inclined to emphasize the intellect or the importance of intellectual pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The intellectualistic student always sought out challenging academic opportunities.
meanings.sent2: She had an intellectualistic approach to learning, always seeking to expand her knowledge.
meanings.sent3: His intellectualistic nature led him to spend hours in deep thought about the universe.
meanings.sent4: The intellectualistic mindset of the group pushed them to explore complex ideas together.
meanings.sent5: Their intellectualistic conversations sparked a passion for learning in everyone involved.
